revised_title: On the Structure and Function of the Membrana Tympani in Elephants and Other Animals
tldr: The author compares the structure of the membrana tympani in humans and elephants, explaining how the unique structure of the elephant's ear allows it to hear sounds at a great distance. The study also shows similarities in the structure of the membrana tympani in other animals like cattle and deer.
